node.title: Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, says paid family leave ‘is not just about the mom.’
node.description: “It sets us up for economic growth and success, but it also just allows people to have that very sacred time as a family.”
node.content: ["Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, has been hitting the phones, calling members of Congress to garner support for paid family leave in the United States.", "\u201cI just get the phone number, and I call and have a conversation,\u201d she told Andrew Ross Sorkin at the DealBook Online Summit on Tuesday. \u201cPeople are pretty surprised, I think.\u201d", "Meghan\u2019s outreach comes as Democrats have debated whether to include paid leave in a sweeping policy bill. The United States is the only rich country that does not have national paid maternity leave. The administration has met with business leaders to underscore the importance of paid family leave to the economy, with the share of women working for pay at its lowest level since 1986.", "\u201cThis is one of those issues that is not red or blue,\u201d Meghan said. \u201cIt sets us up for economic growth and success, but it also just allows people to have that very sacred time as a family.\u201d", "Meghan added, \u201cit takes strong men, modern men, to really understand they benefit from it as well\u201d and that \u201cit is not just about the mom.\u201d", "Meghan also addressed \u201cambition,\u201d which she said has become a \u201ctrigger word\u201d for some, particularly when applied to women.", "\u201cThere is nothing wrong,\u201d she said, with women talking about \u201csuccess, ambition, or financial prowess.\u201d", "Among Meghan\u2019s recent projects, she and her husband, Prince Harry, have joined Ethic, a fintech asset manager in the fast-growing environmental, social and governance, or E.S.G., space, as \u201cimpact partners\u201d and investors. Ethic has $1.3 billion under management and creates separately managed accounts to invest in social responsibility themes.", "Mellody Hobson, the co-chief executive and president of Ariel Investments, who joined Meghan at the summit, said she has occasionally felt she needs to manage differently as a female boss.", "\u201cI have found myself having, at times, to modulate myself in order to win,\u201d said Ms. Hobson. \u201cI don\u2019t think there\u2019s anything wrong with that. Sometimes I can also be big.\u201d", "Ms. Hobson and Meghan also addressed workplace diversity initiatives.", "\u201cI do believe the number-one beneficiary of diversity initiatives in this country has been white women,\u201d Ms. Hobson said. \u201cI think the problem is that there is this scenario that is created, and it is a zero-sum game \u2014 and it is not.\u201d"]
